name: Undergraduate Research
long_desc: Open to sophomore, junior, and senior physics majors. The student undertakes a project of interest under the supervision of a faculty member for 3 to 9 units of credit. May include research done in a research lab, extending the capabilities of a teaching lab, or a theoretical or computational physics project. The student experiences the less structured atmosphere of a research program where there is much room for independent initiative. Student should contact faculty directly to inquire about opportunities. Registration requires approval of the Director of Undergraduate Affairs.

custom_fields.goals: Students will develop important disciplinespecific knowledge as well as professional skills such as technical communication. Outcomes will vary depending on the students project and Faculty Research Advisor.
custom_fields.key_topics: Students will work on a research project in an area of physics that may include: astrophysics & cosmology, biophysics, computational physics, condensed matter physics, nuclear & particle physics, or theoretical physics.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students should have completed first-year physics classes, although some Faculty Research Advisors may require additional or more specific experience and knowledge.
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
Metrics that faculty research advisors will consider when assigning a letter grade for undergraduate research include the student's:
-Development of specialized physics knowledge and/or technical skills important for their research project at a level appropriate for their experience.
-Effectiveness and timeliness of communication with their research advisor and other group members as appropriate. This includes proactively seeking advice or feedback, responding to messages, and/or attending meetings as scheduled.
-Demonstrated ability and willingness to take direction and accept feedback, adjusting their work accordingly, if required.
-Demonstrated good effort at completing necessary steps for their research in a timely manner as appropriate for their level of experience and the number of units registered.
-Creation and maintenance of an accurate record of their work, as directed by the faculty research advisor, such as in a lab notebook or through backup of digital files.
-Overall professional behavior and adherence to university guidelines regarding academic integrity and responsible conduct of research.
-Delivery of a paper (Fall), presentation (Fall), or poster (Fall or Spring).
-Other metrics as specified by the Faculty Research Advisor
custom_fields.relevance: Research opportunities allow students to expand on and apply the knowledge and skills they develop in classes, and here at CMU that means they are working with our world-class faculty on projects at the scientific frontier. Undergraduate research is an essential step for students considering a research-based graduate degree, such as a Ph.D., but also provides valuable work experience for those seeking to enter the workforce directly after their undergraduate degree.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Resources will vary depending on the student's project and Faculty Research Advisor.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students will be required to present their work in the Department of Physics Undergraduate Research Symposium, held every April.
